go_data.justification: MyoD is a myogenic transcription factor that plays an important role in regulating muscle differentiation.
MyoD plays an important role in regulating muscle differentiation.
As a transcription factor, MyoD localizes to the nucleus to regulate the expression of muscle-specific genes.
NF-kappaB inhibits myogenic differentiation through the reduction of MyoD levels.

go_data.term: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
go_data.justification: MyoD, belonging to the family of helix-loop-helix transcription factors, is involved in the regulation of gene expression.
